text: Paul McMullen (February 19, 1972 - March 4, 2021) was an American middle- distance runner. He was known for running in the 1500 meters. He competed at the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta, Georgia. McMullen finished tenth at the 1995 World Championships in Athletics. McMullen was killed in a skiing accident in Michigan on March 4, 2021 at the age of 49. ==References== Category:1972 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American middle-distance runners Category:Olympians for the United States Category:Sportspeople from Michigan Category:Skiing deaths
title: Paul McMullen
